author: KirkMunro
body:
Certain exceptions prevent PowerShell from properly setting the `HistoryId` property in the `InvocationInfo` of the `ErrorRecord` that gets recorded in `$error`. This makes it difficult to associate errors with their appropriate history command that was invoked.

In cases when `HistoryId` is not set, it produces a value of `-1`.

# Steps to reproduce

Run the following commands, one at a time, in a new PowerShell session:

```powershell
function Test-ErrorHistoryId {
    [CmdletBinding()]
    param(
        [Parameter(Mandatory)]
        [ScriptBlock]
        $ScriptBlock
    )
    $global:LastHistoryId = $MyInvocation.HistoryId
    . $ScriptBlock
}
Test-ErrorHistoryId -ScriptBlock {1/0}
$error[0].InvocationInfo.HistoryId -eq $global:LastHistoryId
Test-ErrorHistoryId -ScriptBlock {[CmdletBinding(InvalidArg=$true)]param(); 'What?'}
$error[0].InvocationInfo.HistoryId -eq $global:LastHistoryId
Test-ErrorHistoryId -ScriptBlock {try {1/0} catch {Write-Error 'Divided by Zero'}}
$error[0].InvocationInfo.HistoryId -eq $global:LastHistoryId
```

# Expected behavior

```none
True
True
True
```

# Actual behavior

```none
False
False
True
```

# Environment data

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-preview.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17763
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
title: Fix `HistoryId` in ErrorRecords
